subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Future of Science and Religion
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Future of Science and Religion usable.

hook.text: AI, gene editing, space travel. The 21st century will force religion and science to talk more, not less. Stakes rise.

buildup.text: As science gains power to edit genes, create AI minds, and extend life, religious ethics become more vital, not less.

discovery.text: Religion provides moral frameworks that science cannot generate on its own. 'Can we?' needs 'should we?' beside it.

twist.text: The new generation cares less about the old debate. They want science and spirituality to work together, not compete.

climax.text: The future belongs to those who can hold both: scientific rigor and spiritual depth. The either-or era is ending.

punchline.text: Science says 'can we?' Religion says 'should we?' The future needs both.

quiz.question: Why will religion and science need to cooperate more in the future?
options: Advances in AI, genetics, and technology require moral frameworks science can't provide
